shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables local video capture.
Enables or disables local video capture.
Enables or disables local video capture.
Enables or disables local video capture.

section.p: This method disables or re-enables local video capture without affecting the reception of remote video. After calling , local video capture is enabled by default. If you call enableLocalVideo(false) in a channel to disable local video capture, it also stops publishing the video stream in the channel. To re-enable it, call enableLocalVideo(true), then call and set the options parameter to publish the locally captured video stream to the channel. After successfully disabling or enabling local video capture, the remote user receives the callback.

This method disables or re-enables local video capture without affecting the reception of remote video. After calling , local video capture is enabled by default. If you call enableLocalVideo(false) in a channel, it stops local video capture and also stops publishing the video stream in the channel. To re-enable it, call enableLocalVideo(true), then call and set the options parameter to publish the locally captured video stream to the channel. After successfully enabling or disabling local video capture, the remote side triggers the callback.

This method disables or re-enables local video capture and does not affect receiving remote video. After calling , local video capture is enabled by default. If you call enableLocalVideo(false) in a channel to disable local video capture, it also stops publishing the video stream in the channel. To re-enable, call enableLocalVideo(true), then call and set the options parameter to publish the captured video stream to the channel. After successfully enabling or disabling local video capture, the remote side receives the callback.

This method disables or re-enables local video capture without affecting the reception of remote video. After calling , local video capture is enabled by default. If you call EnableLocalVideo(false) in the channel to disable local video capture, it also stops publishing the video stream in the channel. To re-enable it, call EnableLocalVideo(true), then call and set the options parameter to publish the locally captured video stream to the channel. After successfully enabling or disabling local video capture, the remote side triggers the callback.

ul.li: This method can be called before or after joining a channel, but settings made before joining take effect only after joining.
This method sets the internal engine to an enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel, but the settings take effect only after joining the channel.
This method sets the internal engine to the enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel. However, settings made before joining only take effect after joining.
This method sets the internal engine to an enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel, but settings made before joining only take effect after joining.
This method sets the internal engine to an enabled state and remains effective after leaving the channel.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable local video capture.
: (Default) Enables local video capture.
: Disables local video capture. After disabling, the remote user will not receive the local user's video stream; however, the local user can still receive the remote user's video stream. When set to , this method does not require a local camera.

Whether to enable local video capture.
: (Default) Enables local video capture.
: Disables local video capture. After disabling, remote users will not receive the local user's video stream, but the local user can still receive remote video streams. When set to , this method does not require a local camera.

Whether to enable local video capture.
: (Default) Enable local video capture.
: Disable local video capture. After disabling, the remote user cannot receive the local video stream, but the local user can still receive the remote video stream. When set to , this method does not require a local camera.

Whether to enable local video capture.
: (default) Enable local video capture.
: Disable local video capture. After disabling, the remote user will not receive the local user's video stream; however, the local user can still receive the remote user's video stream. When set to , this method does not require the local device to have a camera.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting tips.
< 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
